intro: Connarus unifoliolatus, commonly known as the single leaf connarus, is a unique species belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its singular, elongated leaf that emerges directly from the stem, lacking any stipules or branching. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits. Due to its distinctive morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
